channel.title: The Propper Way To Make Custome Crowns
channel.description:
Okay, this has been bugging the hell out of me. I have seen sprite creations and long tutorials that mean nothing really.
Difficulty: 3/10 Knowledge: Copy And Paste and Searching Files Used: Toms Cache Editor, Client.Java Important!
BACKUP YOUR FILES IN CASE YOU GET ERRORS THE FIRST TIME DOING THIS!
So I shall show you how to do this on 2 clients.
DeltaScape Client Tutorial:
N/A Yet
Galkons Client:
Okay, so you will need a few things first.
Heres what you will need.
Toms Cache Suite:
http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?rnlkmqzhz3j
Okay, first heres how you load your cache:
THESE SCREENSHOTS WERE NOT TAKEN BY ME!
[img]http://i719.photobucket.com/albums/ww193/JungleStory/JarPic.png[/img] [img]http://i719.photobucket.com/albums/ww193/JungleStory/FileLoad.png[/img] [img]http://i719.photobucket.com/albums/ww193/JungleStory/OpenCache.png[/img] [img]http://i719.photobucket.com/albums/ww193/JungleStory/Archive.png[/img] [img]http://i719.photobucket.com/albums/ww193/JungleStory/MediaButton.png[/img]
Now, look for the thing called, "mod_icons.dat"
Okay, the next few lines of this tutorial will be hateful...
This is a very detailed explanation of what the stuff does. Color coded so you don't get lost...
[IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/70iel2.jpg[/img]
Okay, so now that you have done that, export the crown and save it as "cr3"
It will save as cr3.file Now, open it with paint, you will see a material kinda like this:
[img]http://i719.photobucket.com/albums/ww193/JungleStory/PinkColor.png[/img]
Now, you can use any image you want, so I'm going to use...An $ because I know many people want the fucking donator icon...
Like This:
[IMG]http://i41.tinypic.com/2due1lf.png[/img]
NOTE: I use the magnifying tool on the image.
Ok, now. We will put it into the client using the cache editor...
Like This:
[IMG]http://i41.tinypic.com/2h5iv5l.png[/img]
Now, heres more tortue...read...
[IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/azew08.png[/img]
Then:
[IMG]http://i41.tinypic.com/2mq0tat.png[/img]
Now, go into your client and open up, "client.java"
In there, search for this first:
[code]cr2[/code]
You should find this:
[code] if(s1 != null && s1.startsWith("@cr2@")) { s1 = s1.substring(5); byte0 = 2; }[/code]
Let me explain this a bit. "cr2" means thats what we call it for later use. byte0 = 2 means...player rights = 2.
So, you would want to add this under it.
[code] if(s1 != null && s1.startsWith("@cr3@")) { s1 = s1.substring(5); byte0 = -1;//player rights }[/code]
keep searching for "cr2" and whenever you find it, put that underneath, unless you come across this type:
[code] if(myPrivilege == 2) pushMessage(myPlayer.textSpoken, 2, "@cr2@" + myPlayer.name); else[/code]
then, under that just post this:
[code] if(myPrivilege == -1)//player rights pushMessage(myPlayer.textSpoken, 2, "@cr3@" + myPlayer.name);//when you talk... else[/code]
then when you come to something looking like this:
[code] if(j2 == 2) pushMessage(s, 1, "@cr2@" + player.name); else[/code]
add this under it:
[code] if(j2 == -1)//player rights pushMessage(s, 1, "@cr3@" + player.name); else[/code]
and, when you come across this:
[code] if(l21 == 2) pushMessage(s9, 7, "@cr2@" + TextClass.fixName(TextClass.nameForLong(l5))); else[/code]
Add this under it:
[code] if(l21 == -1) pushMessage(s9, 7, "@cr3@" + TextClass.fixName(TextClass.nameForLong(l5))); else[/code]
Then...
Search this finally:
[code]modIcons[/code]
You should see this:
[code] if(byte0 == 1) { modIcons[0].drawSprite(j1, i1 - 12); j1 += 14; }[/code]
Under that, add this:
[code] if(byte0 == -1)//player rights { modIcons[2].drawSprite(j1, i1 - 12);//[2] means 3 j1 += 14; }[/code]
Keep doing this until you come to this, this is were many people make the mistake of adding custom sprites, we added our custom stuff into the cache, so we don't need any .png files that affect any other .java files.
So when you see this:
[code] for(int l4 = 0; l4 < 3; l4++) modIcons[l4] = new Sprite(streamLoader_2, "mod_icons", l4);[/code]
Change it to this:
[code] for(int l4 = 0; l4 < 4; l4++)//the < 4 means that these 3 or less files to load modIcons[l4] = new Sprite(streamLoader_2, "mod_icons", l4);[/code]
Now, search for:
[code] modIcons = new Sprite[3];[/code]
Change the [3] to [4].
Then...save and compile!
And when you run the client, you should see this when you talk with player rights -1 or whatever you set it to.
[IMG]http://i40.tinypic.com/2nw0182.png[/img]
If you get errors, re-do the tutorial about 5 times. If you still get errors, pm me.

item.title: The Propper Way To Make Custome Crowns
item.dc:creator: @wolfs_goal wolfs goal
item.description:
@wolfs_goal wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:14, topic:332515”][quote author=T3arful link=topic=428947.msg3149860#msg3149860 date=1268440462]

Your failing to notice that the client-sided command “::noclip” can only be done if you are admin+ to the client, if you add more crowns ontop of the Admin, you will need to fix some lines of code in the client-sided part.

No you don’t. This was is completely fine. As to why people have started posting tutorials for this crap is beyond me. All you’re doing is copying code that is already in the client and changing a few numbers. That is it.
[/quote]

To check playerRights in a command inside of the client, noclip was done for ‘playerRights >= 2’ originally, so thus meaning, adding more crowns creates higher playerRights inside of the client to get crowns. Sure, you wont need to worry about it if you dont fix the server-sided parts, but its how it works.[/quote]

The fact is in my client, I removed all the commands like ::noclip and ::fps and ::nowall.

Same thing with the server side, and on the server side, it uses lists to check who can do what commands.

So if I gave someone on my server rights 10, they can’t do any other owner or mod and admin stuff unless I put them on the list of exceptions.

And its not just changing a few numbers, this is showing the basic way of using the cache editor instead of just masking over old images. It keeps old images, and it allows you to have a great client. Same thing with models, I pack my models into the cache, not into a models folder. It allows me to stop masking over objects and that kind of stuff.

Read full topic
item.source: The Propper Way To Make Custome Crowns

[quote=“T3arful, post:13, topic:332515”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=428947.msg3149506#msg3149506 date=1268416274]
Your failing to notice that the client-sided command “::noclip” can only be done if you are admin+ to the client, if you add more crowns ontop of the Admin, you will need to fix some lines of code in the client-sided part.
[/quote]
No you don’t. This was is completely fine. As to why people have started posting tutorials for this crap is beyond me. All you’re doing is copying code that is already in the client and changing a few numbers. That is it.[/quote]

To check playerRights in a command inside of the client, noclip was done for ‘playerRights >= 2’ originally, so thus meaning, adding more crowns creates higher playerRights inside of the client to get crowns. Sure, you wont need to worry about it if you dont fix the server-sided parts, but its how it works.

Your failing to notice that the client-sided command “::noclip” can only be done if you are admin+ to the client, if you add more crowns ontop of the Admin, you will need to fix some lines of code in the client-sided part.[/quote]

item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Just so you know there is no “proper” way to make custom crowns. Your just doing it with the least work possible.

Your failing to notice that the client-sided command “::noclip” can only be done if you are admin+ to the client, if you add more crowns ontop of the Admin, you will need to fix some lines of code in the client-sided part.

Read full topic

item.title: The Propper Way To Make Custome Crowns
item.dc:creator: @T3arful T3arful
item.description:
@T3arful wrote:

You don’t need to set the Y offset to 1. The Y offset is for positioning (although I don’t know why it makes the image transparent). Once you’ve added an image (using ‘+’) just click import and import the image again then save the archive. It makes it transparent if the RGB is 255 0 255.

Read full topic
item.source: The Propper Way To Make Custome Crowns

item.title: The Propper Way To Make Custome Crowns
item.dc:creator: @wolfs_goal wolfs goal
item.description:
@wolfs_goal wrote:

B2300 T4nk:

Galkon made a guide on this.

I remember he had a guide somewhat like this, but he was loading them through sprites. I’m making it so you don’t have to infect any other file besides client.java.

For example…With sprites you usually have to add them in the client.java, then add them in a new loading sprite, then add them into a class file(not sure what number). This is a way simpler and less complex way.

Read full topic

item.title: The Propper Way To Make Custome Crowns
item.dc:creator: @wolfs_goal wolfs goal
item.description:
@wolfs_goal wrote:

Okay, this has been bugging the hell out of me. I have seen sprite creations and long tutorials that mean nothing really.

Difficulty: 3/10
Knowledge: Copy And Paste and Searching
Files Used: Toms Cache Editor, Client.Java
Important!

BACKUP YOUR FILES IN CASE YOU GET ERRORS THE FIRST TIME DOING THIS!

So I shall show you how to do this on 2 clients.

DeltaScape Client Tutorial:

N/A Yet

Galkons Client:

Okay, so you will need a few things first.

Heres what you will need.

Toms Cache Suite:

http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?rnlkmqzhz3j

Okay, first heres how you load your cache:

THESE SCREENSHOTS WERE NOT TAKEN BY ME!

JarPic.png799×599

FileLoad.png899×698


Archive.png899×700

Now, look for the thing called, “mod_icons.dat”

Okay, the next few lines of this tutorial will be hateful…

This is a very detailed explanation of what the stuff does. Color coded so you don’t get lost…

70iel2.jpg885×622

Okay, so now that you have done that, export the crown and save it as “cr3”

It will save as cr3.file Now, open it with paint, you will see a material kinda like this:

Now, you can use any image you want, so I’m going to use…An $ because I know many people want the fucking donator icon…

Like This:

NOTE: I use the magnifying tool on the image.

Ok, now. We will put it into the client using the cache editor…

Like This:

2h5iv5l.png840×564

Now, heres more tortue…read…

azew08.png811×478

Then:

2mq0tat.png814×531

Now, go into your client and open up, “client.java”

In there, search for this first:

cr2

You should find this:

if(s1 != null && s1.startsWith("@cr2@")) { s1 = s1.substring(5); byte0 = 2; }

Let me explain this a bit. “cr2” means thats what we call it for later use.
byte0 = 2 means…player rights = 2.

So, you would want to add this under it.

if(s1 != null && s1.startsWith("@cr3@")) { s1 = s1.substring(5); byte0 = -1;//player rights }

keep searching for “cr2” and whenever you find it, put that underneath, unless you come across this type:

if(myPrivilege == 2) pushMessage(myPlayer.textSpoken, 2, "@cr2@" + myPlayer.name); else

then, under that just post this:

if(myPrivilege == -1)//player rights pushMessage(myPlayer.textSpoken, 2, "@cr3@" + myPlayer.name);//when you talk... else

then when you come to something looking like this:

if(j2 == 2) pushMessage(s, 1, "@cr2@" + player.name); else

add this under it:

if(j2 == -1)//player rights pushMessage(s, 1, "@cr3@" + player.name); else

and, when you come across this:

if(l21 == 2) pushMessage(s9, 7, "@cr2@" + TextClass.fixName(TextClass.nameForLong(l5))); else

Add this under it:

if(l21 == -1) pushMessage(s9, 7, "@cr3@" + TextClass.fixName(TextClass.nameForLong(l5))); else

Then…

Search this finally:

modIcons

You should see this:

if(byte0 == 1) { modIcons[0].drawSprite(j1, i1 - 12); j1 += 14; }

Under that, add this:

if(byte0 == -1)//player rights { modIcons[2].drawSprite(j1, i1 - 12);//[2] means 3 j1 += 14; }

Keep doing this until you come to this, this is were many people make the mistake of adding custom sprites, we added our custom stuff into the cache, so we don’t need any .png files that affect any other .java files.

So when you see this:

for(int l4 = 0; l4 < 3; l4++) modIcons[l4] = new Sprite(streamLoader_2, "mod_icons", l4);

Change it to this:

for(int l4 = 0; l4 < 4; l4++)//the < 4 means that these 3 or less files to load modIcons[l4] = new Sprite(streamLoader_2, "mod_icons", l4);

Now, search for:

        modIcons = new Sprite[3];

Change the [3] to [4].

Then…save and compile!

And when you run the client, you should see this when you talk with player rights -1 or whatever you set it to.

If you get errors, re-do the tutorial about 5 times. If you still get errors, pm me.

Read full topic
item.source: The Propper Way To Make Custome Crowns
